name: Mount Mack

trails_config.name: Mack and Anna Loop
trails_config.description: A classic 'patch hike' loop in the Belknaps. Offers several ledge views overlooking Lake Winnipesaukee and the Alton Bay area.
trails_config.parking_info: Mount Major Trailhead Parking, NH-11, Alton, NH

current_conditions.ai_summary: One of New Hampshire's premier peaks, Mount Mack rises to 1945 feet. It is known for its rugged terrain and panoramic vistas.
risk_factors: Check local trail conditions before departing.
Start early to avoid afternoon storms.

generated_description:
The Experience

Standing at 1945 feet, Mount Mack is a standout peak in New Hampshire. Known for its approachable and scenic terrain, it offers a quintessential hiking experience.

The Challenge

Hikers often choose the **Mack and Anna Loop**, a **5.0 mile** route gaining significant elevation. As part of the **local peak challenge**, it draws peak-baggers from across the region.

Peak Bagging Logic

This peak stands relatively isolated, offering a solitary summit experience.
